title: Sanna Karapusa| Snack
content:
Snack recipe: Sanna Karapusa / Senagapindi karallu Yields: 12¬† Duration: 30 minutes Sanna Karapusa is a traditional south Indian snack recipe, it's so easy to make and nice to munch on at any time and also you can pack this snack in the lunch box as a side dish pairs well with dal rice, sambar rice, and rasam rice as well or you can eat as is. One of my most favorite childhood snacks is sanna karapusa I wish you could try this simplest snack recipe and enjoy any time! Let's start with ingredients and follows the procedure Ingredients: 1 cup = 160 gms
  • Besan flour /¬† Chickpea flour - 2 cups
  • Rice flour - 1/2 cup
  • Turmeric powder - 1/2 teaspoon
  • Red chilly powder - 1 1/2 teaspoons
  • Salt - 1 1/2 teaspoons
  • Baking soda - 1/8 teaspoon
  • Oil - to deep fry
  • Water - as required - to make the dough
  • Chakli maker and small holes round jali - to make karapusa
Procedure:¬†
  • Take a big deep bowl, add in besan flour, rice flour, salt, red chilly powder, turmeric powder, baking soda and mix well
  • Make a thick dough by adding water little by little ( the dough should be soft and not runny, can verify the photo below)
  • Now, take chakli maker then apply little oil in it and put the dough in it
  • Next spread karapusa in oil by rotating chakli maker and make sure the oil should be on medium-high heat not smoking hot. ( do this process if only you are aware and have practice making karapusa otherwise you should take help from others)
  • It won't take so much time to fry because these are very thin and light
  • Try to takeout them when the bubbling stops or you can see the color changes to a light golden brown, to remove excess oil take them on kitchen tissues
  • Repeat the process till the dough completes
  • very simple and traditional south Indian snack is ready to serve
  • Happy Cooking and Have a good day :-)
